title: Statism in Shōwa Japan
summary: Shōwa Statism (国家主義, Kokka Shugi) was a political syncretism of Japanese extreme political ideologies, developed over a period of time from the Meiji Restoration. It is sometimes also referred to as  Emperor-system fascism (天皇制ファシズム),[1] Shōwa nationalism or Japanese fascism.
